args.content:
import Mathlib

open Filter
open Topology

/-- For a complex-valued function, convergence to `L` at infinity in the sense of the
Riemann sphere is equivalent to the usual Îµâ€“M definition: for every Îµ > 0 there exists
M such that |f z - L| < Îµ whenever |z| > M. -/
theorem tendsto_at_infty_riemann_sphere_iff {f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} {L : â„‚} :
  Tendsto f (Filter.cocompact â„‚) (nhds L) â†”
    âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ M : â„, âˆ€ z : â„‚, abs z > M â†’ abs (f z - L) < Îµ := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- For a complex-valued function, convergence to `L` at infinity in the sense of the
Riemann sphere is equivalent to the usual Îµâ€“M definition: for every Îµ > 0 there exists
M such that |f z - L| < Îµ whenever |z| > M. -/
theorem tendsto_at_infty_riemann_sphere_iff {f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} {L : â„‚} :
  Filter.Tendsto f (Filter.cocompact (X := â„‚)) (nhds (L : â„‚)) â†”
    âˆ€ Îµ : â„, Îµ > 0 â†’ âˆƒ M : â„, âˆ€ z : â„‚, (abs z : â„) > M â†’ (abs (f z - L) : â„) < Îµ := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- For a complex-valued function, convergence to `L` at infinity in the sense of the
Riemann sphere is equivalent to the usual Îµâ€“M definition: for every Îµ > 0 there exists
M such that Complex.abs (f z - L) < Îµ whenever Complex.abs z > M. -/
theorem tendsto_at_infty_riemann_sphere_iff {f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} {L : â„‚} :
  Filter.Tendsto f (Filter.cocompact (X := â„‚)) (nhds (L : â„‚)) â†”
    âˆ€ Îµ : â„, Îµ > 0 â†’ âˆƒ M : â„, âˆ€ z : â„‚, Complex.abs z > M â†’ Complex.abs (f z - L) < Îµ := by sorry
